data.title: Obituaries
data.text:
Most Reverend Francisco Gonzalez Valer, S.F.

Most Reverend Francisco Gonzalez Valer, S.F., 84, passed away on March 4 in Spain.

He was ordained on May 1, 1964, for the Sons of the Holy Family. He served as assistant pastor and pastor at Holy Cross in Santa Cruz from 1976 - 1981.

Please pray for the repose of the soul of Most Reverend Francisco Gonzalez Valer, S.F., and for his family and friends.

Deacon Gregorio Henderson

Deacon Gregorio Henderson, father of Rev. Agustin Henderson, pastor of Holy Family/St. Joseph in Roy and Santa Clara in Wagon Mound and its missions, passed away on January 18, 2024 at the age of 66 in Tucson, AZ.

Deacon Henderson was ordained a deacon on July 12, 2003. He served at San Jose in Albuquerque, was a member of the Archdiocesan Pastoral Council at Santuario de San Martin de Porres in Albuquerque, and served in the Diocese of Tucson.

Sr. Juanita Marie Gonzales, SC

Sr. Juanita Marie Gonzales, S.C., 85, beloved member of the Sisters of Charity, passed away on December 29, 2023. She was preceded in death by her sisters Dolores Gutierrez, Angela Sanches, Teresa Ojinage, and Maria Gonzales; brothers Felipe, Luis, and Enrique Gonzales, and is survived by sisters Anna Espinoza and Rufugia Rodriguez, brothers Antonio, Fidencio, Xavier, and Moises Gonzales, as well as nieces, nephews, and the Sisters of Charity Community. Sr. Juanita served as a catechetical leader in San Isidro in the Santa Fe Deanery.

Reverend Ronald Stone

Fr. Ronald Stone passed away at the age of 69 on Dec. 8, 2023 in the Diocese of Knoxville. Fr. Stone was ordained on June 2, 2001, and served as parochial vicar at St. Thomas Aquinas in Rio Rancho, as pastor at Holy Trinity in Arroyo Seco, as pastor at St. Alice in Mountainair, in Hospital Ministry, as pastor at San Miguel del Vado in Ribera, as canonical pastor at Our Lady of Guadalupe in Villanueva, as a confessor for Handmaids of the Precious Blood, as pastor at Our Lady of Guadalupe in Villanueva, and he had been serving in the Diocese of Knoxville. A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated Dec. 19 at 1:30 p.m. at the Cathedral Basilica of St. Francis of Assisi in Santa Fe. Interment will follow at Rosario Cemetery in Santa Fe. To live-stream the Funeral Mass, click here.

Deacon Eli Luis Casaus

Deacon Luis Eli Casaus, 87, passed away on Nov. 15, 2023. Deacon Luis served in parishes in Las Vegas and Albuquerque. He was a faithful and devout Catholic, attending Our Lady of the Most Holy Rosary Church. A creative artisan, he enjoyed wood carving. Other hobbies included gardening, swimming, and spending time with family and friends. Luis appreciated special friendships with many groups, including Alzheimer's support, carving classes, and church/deacon affiliations.

Sr. Marlene Kuhnlein, OP

Sr. Marlene Kuhnlein, formerly known as Sr. Anthony Irene, died on Oct. 28, 2023, at the Dominican Life Center in Adrian, MI. She was 89 and in the 72nd year of her religious profession in the Adrian Dominican Congregation. Sr. Marlene was born in Chicago, IL, graduated from St. Joseph Academy in Adrian, and received a Bachelor of Arts degree in Latin from Siena Heights College (University) in Adrian, a Master of Education degree from DePaul University in Chicago, and a Master of Social Work degree in clinical social work from Barry College (University) in Miami Shores, FL. Sister served the Congregation as secretary for the Southwest Chapter Office from 1989-93 in Albuquerque, NM, and Mesa, AZ.

Reverend James Vance

Fr. James Vance passed away on Sunday, July 23, 2023, at 84 in Albuquerque. The Most Rev. Edwin Vincent Byrne ordained him to the priesthood on May 25, 1963, at St. Francis Cathedral in Santa Fe. As an assistant, he served in the parishes of Our Lady of the Assumption in Albuquerque, Santa Rita in Carrizozo, Our Lady of Sorrows in Bernalillo, Cristo Rey, and St. John the Baptist, both in Santa Fe. He was pastor of St. Vincent de Paul Church in Maxwell, St. Anthony in Questa, Immaculate Conception in Cimarron, St. Anne in Tucumcari, St. Francis Xavier in Clayton, St. Joseph in Raton, San Martin de Porres in Albuquerque and San Ysidro in Corrales. He served as the dean of the northeast deanery from 1984 to 1992.

Sister Nancy Kazik, OFM

Born to Eternal Life May 12, 2023, age 87. Survivors include the Sisters of St. Francis of Assisi, with whom she shared life for nearly 70 years. Born in Milwaukee, WI, Sr. Nancy served in the Archdiocese of Santa Fe from 1988-2005 as executive director of Pastoral Ministries and vicar for religious; editor for the archdiocesan newspaper, People of God; vice-chancellor for the archdiocese; and religious case manager for sexual abuse cases and outreach to victims. In retirement, she served on boards, committees, and as a consultant.

Father Joseph Vanderholt, SJ

Fr. Joseph M. Vanderholt, SJ, died May 6, 2023, in Land O’Lakes, FL. He was 85 years old, a Jesuit for 67 years, and a priest for 54 years.

He is remembered by his Jesuit brothers as a priest of humble demeanor and a kind and gentle confessor. His longest assignment was at Immaculate Conception Parish in Albuquerque from 2001 to 2021. In 2021, he began his final assignment as a pastoral minister at Jesuit High School in Tampa, FL.

Reverend George Salazar

Fr. George Salazar passed away on April 26, 2023. Fr. George was ordained on May 13, 1967. He served as assistant pastor and administer pro-tem at Our Lady of Guadalupe in Santa Fe, as assistant director of Youth Office at the Archdiocese of Santa Fe, as pastor at Holy Trinity in Arroyo Seco, as a member of the College of Consultors, as pastor at San Felipe de Neri in Albuquerque, as director and chaplain of the Committee for Marriage Encounter and Marriage Enrichment for the Archdiocese of Santa Fe, as pastor pro tem at St. Alice in Mountainair, as pastor at St. John the Baptist in Santa Fe, as pastor at Immaculate Conception in Las Vegas, as Dean of the Northwest Deanery, as a member of the personnel board, as pastor of Our Lady of Guadalupe in Taos and San Geronimo Mission in Taos Pueblo, as archdiocesan spiritual director for Cursillo Movement, as canonical pastor at San Jose in Anton Chico, and he was the spiritual director for Los Hermanos Cruzados.

Reverend Edward Okpu

Fr. Edward Okpu, 48, passed away April 4, 2023, in Albuquerque. Fr. Okpu was ordained on July 23, 201I for the Diocese of Bomadi in Nigeria. He served as parochial vicar at Our Lady of Fatima in Albuquerque.

Reverend Francis E. Renfroe, SJ

Fr. Francis E. Renfroe, SJ, died Feb. 4, 2023, in Grand Coteau, La. He was 90 years old, a Jesuit for 67 years and a priest for 54 years.

Fr. Renfroe attended Jesuit College Preparatory School in Dallas, graduating in 1949, before serving in the U.S. Navy from 1953 – 1955. Feeling called to religious life, he entered the Society of Jesus (the Jesuits) on Sept. 19, 1955, at St. Charles College in Grand Coteau. He served as the pastor of Immaculate Conception in Albuquerque.

In 1980, Fr. Renfroe accepted a missionary assignment at Parroquia Nazareth in Asunción, Paraguay. This was followed by similar assignments in Posadas, Argentina (1981-83), where he was also the Jesuit superior, and Villa Cristina in Asunción, where he again served as Jesuit superior. He returned to Immaculate Conception, where he served from 1991 to 2000.

Deacon Juan "Andy" Dimas

Deacon Andy Dimas passed away on January 19, 2023, at the age of 77. Deacon Dimas was ordained a deacon on July 12, 2003, and served at St. Anne Parish in Santa Fe. He was the chaplain at the N.M. State Penitentiary for five years. He continued to work with the prison after he retired from the N.M. State Penitentiary.

Deacon John Russo

Deacon John Russo passed away on Monday, November 14, 2022, at the age of 76. Deacon Russo was ordained a deacon on June 7, 1987. He served at Saint John XXIII Catholic Community in Albuquerque.

Deacon P. Louis Montoya

Deacon P. Louis Montoya passed away on Saturday, October 29, 2022, at the age of 84. Deacon Montoya was ordained a deacon on May 20, 1978. He served at St. Francis Xavier in Clayton and served as chaplain at the prison facility in Clayton.

Reverend Tin Manh Bui

Reverend Tin Manh Bui passed away at the age of 76 on Friday, October 28, 2022, in Albuquerque, NM. Rev. Bui was ordained on April 15, 1975, for the Diocese of Long Xuyen, a Suffragan Diocese of Saigon. He served as parochial vicar, administrator, and pastor at Our Lady of Lavang in Albuquerque.

Sister Mary Catherine Nolan, OP

Sr. Mary Catherine Nolan, formerly known as Sr. John David, died on Thursday, October 27, 2022, at the Dominican Life Center in Adrian. She was 89 years of age and in the 70th year of her religious profession in the Adrian Dominican Congregation. Sister ministered in Albuquerque at the House of Hospitality from 1999-2002.

Deacon Kenneth Trujillo

Deacon Kenneth Trujillo passed away on Friday, September 23, 2022, at the age of 77. Deacon Trujillo was ordained on June 16, 2007, and served at Santuario de San Martin de Porres in Albuquerque.

Sr. Barbara Ann Mason, OP

Sr. Barbara Ann Mason, formerly known as Sr. Augustine Mary, died on Wednesday, September 14, 2022, at the Dominican Life Center in Adrian. She was 89 years of age and in the 72nd year of her religious profession in the Adrian Dominican Congregation.

Sister spent 48 years in education in Oakland, Oceanside, La Jolla, and San Diego, California; Albuquerque, New Mexico; and Detroit, Michigan. Sister ministered in New Mexico for two years at Sacred Heart as an elementary teacher in Albuquerque from 1952-54.

Reverend Augustine John Moore, Ph.D.

Reverend Augustine John Moore was ordained on May 28, 1960, for the Archdiocese of Santa Fe. He served as Secretary to the Archbishop, as chaplain of Loretto and instructor in English and religion, as assistant pastor of Cristo Rey in Santa Fe, as assistant pastor of Our Lady of Sorrows in Las Vegas, as chaplain of New Mexico State Hospital and Meadow's Home for the Aged in Las Vegas, as a teacher at Our Lady of Sorrows School in Las Vegas, administrator of Our Lady of Sorrows in La Joya, as administrator of San Juan in El Rito, as pastor of Our Lady of Sorrows in Manzano, as pastor of St. Alice in Mountainair, as pastor of St. Joseph in Raton, as pastor of Holy Ghost in Albuquerque, as associate pastor of Our Lady of the Gulf in Gulf Shore, AL, as administrator of Our Lady of Guadalupe in Pojoaque, and as pastor of Sacred Heart in Espanola.

Deacon Alfred Edwin Esquibel

Deacon Alfred Edwin Esquibel passed away on May 4, 2022, at the age of 75. Edwin was born and raised in Belen along with his seven brothers and parents. He is survived by his wife and love of his life, Kathy Sisneros Esquibel, beloved children, grandchildren, and other family. In 1993, Edwin was ordained a deacon for the Archdiocese of Santa Fe. In his lifetime, Edwin wore many hats and held many positions, but his greatest love was to serve his family, friends, and community.

Reverend James Suntum, SF

Reverend James Suntum, SF, parochial vicar of Holy Family in Chimayo, ended his earthly pilgrimage on May 2, 2022.

He spent his last active years serving at Holy Family Parish and Santuario de Chimayo. As a young priest, he served at Holy Cross Parish, in Santa Cruz de la Cañada.

Reverend Hilaire Valiquette, O.F.M.

Reverend Hilaire Valiquette, O.F.M. passed away at the age of 84 on Wednesday, February 2, 2022 in Albuquerque, NM.

Fr. Valiquette was ordained on June 3, 1964, for the Franciscan Order. He served as Pastor at San Juan Mission in Jemez Pueblo, as Parochial Vicar and Pastor at Our Lady of Guadalupe in Pena Blanca, as a member of the Archdiocesan Ecumenical Commission, and as Pastor at St. Augustine in Isleta.

Reverend John Conway

Reverend John Roger Conway passed away at the age of 84 on Friday, January 28, 2022 in Albuquerque, NM.

Fr. Conway was ordained on May 31, 1969 for the Archdiocese of Santa Fe. He served as Parochial Vicar at Our Lady of the Annunciation in Albuquerque, as Associate Spiritual Director for St. Vincent de Paul, as Parochial Vicar for Cristo Rey in Santa Fe, as Parochial Vicar for St. Bernadette in Albuquerque, as Parochial Vicar for Immaculate Heart of Mary in Los Alamos, as Pastor for St. Francis Xavier in Clayton, as Director for Permanent Diaconate Program, as Parochial Vicar for Our Lady of the Most Holy Rosary in Albuquerque, as Pastor Pro Tem at St. Alice in Mountainair, as Pastor at Immaculate Heart of Mary in Los Alamos, as Judge for the Court of Appeals, as Adminstrator Pro Tem for San Clemente in Los Lunas, as Pastor for Holy Child in Tijeras, as Pastor for St. Jude Thaddeus in Albuquerque, and as Defender of the Bond.

Deacon Andrew "Andy" Lopez

Deacon Andrew "Andy" Lopez, age 56, died peacefully on December 27, 2021, surrounded by his loved ones. Andy Lee Lopez was born on May 29, 1965 in Santa Fe, New Mexico to Andres Lopez and Emma Lopez-Sandoval. He is survived by wife Rose, of 25 years, beloved son Robert, Gene, Grandma Jenny, uncles, aunts, cousins, godchildren, and many friends.

Deacon Andy was ordained to the permanent diaconate by Archbishop John C. Wester on June 16, 2018. Deacon Andy was a catechist at St. John the Baptist Catholic Church and was involved with the Penitentes, Knights of Columbus, Caballeros de Vargas (2011 Don Diego de Vargas).

Deacon Juan Miguel Rodriguez

Deacon Juan Miguel Rodriguez, age 91, died peacefully at home on December 19, 2021. He was born on May 15, 1930 in Santa Fe, NM to Isabelita and Juan Rodriguez y Moya. Juan and Marie Pacheco were married on December 26, 1959 in Maxwell, NM. On July 27, 1976, in Maxwell, NM, Juan was ordained to the permanent diaconate by Archbishop Robert F. Sanchez.

Juan was a faithful and loving son, husband, father, father-in-law, grandfather, brother, and tio. Deacon Juan's profound and deep faith sustained him throughout his long life where he was surrounded by people he loved and who loved him.

Reverend Joseph Vigil

Reverend Joseph Vigil, passed away at the age of 69, on Friday, December 3, 2021, in Albuquerque, NM.

Fr. Vigil was ordained on June 21, 1980. He served as assistant pastor at St. John the Baptist in Santa Fe, as a full-time administrator at St. Anthony in Questa, as pastor at San Antonio de Padua in Peñasco, as pastor at Holy Ghost in Albuquerque, as pastor at Our Lady of Guadalupe in Albuquerque, and as chaplain for the Knights of Columbus.

Reverend Gerald Steinmetz, O.F.M.

Reverend Gerald Steinmetz, O.F.M., passed away at the age of 78, on Sunday, October 17, 2021.

Fr. Steinmetz was ordained on June 12, 1971. He served as associate pastor at St. Teresa in Grants, as associate pastor at Cathedral of St. Francis of Assisi in Santa Fe, vocations director for the Franciscans, as associate pastor at St. Francis in Gallup, as pastor at St. Teresa in Grants, as pastor at St. Francis in Juarez, Mexico, as pastor at St. Francis in Tierra Blanca, Peru, as pastor at San Diego Mission in Jemez Pueblo, and as pastor at Holy Family in Albuquerque.

Reverend Monsignor Anthony Bolman

Reverend Monsignor Anthony Bolman passed away at the age of 95, on Sunday, October 3, 2021 in Rio Rancho, NM.

Msgr. Bolman was ordained on May 28, 1960. He served as parochial vicar at St. Francis Xavier in Albuquerque, as parochial vicar at Our Lady of Sorrows in Manzano, as administrator and pastor at Wagon Mound-Santa Clara, as pastor at St. Rita in Carrizozo, as pastor at St. Rose of Lima in Santa Rosa, a member on the Priest Personnel Board, as pastor at Our Lady of Sorrows in Bernalillo, as pastor at St. Anthony in Pecos, as pastor at St. Mary’s in Vaughn, as pastor at Our Lady of Guadalupe in Pojoaque, a member of the Board of Consultors, as pastor at Our Lady of the Most Holy Rosary in Albuquerque, as pastor at St. Joseph in Raton, as pastor at St. Thomas Aquinas in Rio Rancho, and as pastor at Church of the Ascension in Albuquerque.

In Msgr. Bolman’s own words:

“I wish to thank my parents, Anna and Henry—grandparents, Rose and Theodore, my family, relatives, friends and benefactors, all who have shared the gift of life with me; and all who supported me in my priestly vocation. Any and all debts owed to me are ‘paid in full.’ I forgive all who have injured me and ask pardon of all whom I have injured. In your charity, please pray for me.”

Reverend Jose Maria Blanch, S.F.

Reverend Jose Maria Blanch, S.F. passed away at the age of 93 on Sunday, June 27, 2021 in Chimayo, NM.

Fr. Blanch was ordained on March 4, 1951 for the Sons of the Holy Family, Jesus, Mary, and Joseph in Barcelona, Spain. He served in the Archdiocese of Santa Fe since 1975 at Santa Cruz de la Canada Parish in Santa Cruz, at Sacred Heart Parish in Albuquerque, and at Holy Family Parish in Chimayo.

Sr. Patricia Powers, OP

Sr. Patricia Powers, OP, died June 5, 2021, at St. Dominic Villa, Hazel Green, WI. Her religious name was Sr. Jordan.

Sister Pat made her first profession as a Dominican Sister of Sinsinawa Aug. 5, 1944, and her perpetual profession Aug. 5, 1947. In the field of education, she taught for 25 years, was principal for 12 years and tutored migrant workers for four years. Sr. Pat served in parish ministry for eight years, religious education for nine years, chaplain for two years, and support staff for 20 years. Sr. Pat offered a lifetime of steady and competent service in education and administration. She loved well and helped wherever needed. She served in Wisconsin, Illinois, New York, Oklahoma, California; Texas, Florida, and New Mexico.

In the Archdiocese of Santa Fe, Sr. Pat served at St. Therese Parish, Albuquerque, as religious education aid, 1994-1999, and chaplain, 1997-1999.

Deacon William Hoefler

Deacon William Hoefler was ordained on June 19, 1976. Deacon Bill served at the Church of the Ascension when he retired in May 2017, serving 45 years. He was 86 years old.

Sr. Marian Edward Guethlein, OP

Sr. Marian Edward Guethlein, OP, died on Friday, June 4, 2021, at the Dominican Life Center in Adrian, MI. She was 86 years of age, and in the 69th year of her religious profession in the Adrian Dominican Congregation.

She spent 36 years ministering in education in Rockwood, Michigan; Oakland, Santa Cruz and Lodi, California; Albuquerque, New Mexico; Flagstaff and Casa Grande, Arizona; and Henderson, Nevada; including serving as principal for seven years in Oakland and three years in Lodi. Sister served as a receptionist at the Dominican Motherhouse for eight years. She became a resident of the Dominican Life Center in Adrian in 2001.

Sister ministered at Sacred Heart in Albuquerque from 1962-1967.

Deacon Harold Gallegos

Deacon Harold M. Gallegos, 63, of Los Brazos, NM passed away on June 1, 2021 at his home.

Deacon Harold was born on May 14, 1958 in Santa Fe, NM to Manuel and Susie Gallegos. Always strong in his faith, Harold was a long-time member of the Knights of Columbus. On June 21, 2014, he was ordained a deacon at the Cathedral Basilica of St. Francis of Assisi in Santa Fe, NM. He served the San Jose and St. Patrick parishes in northern New Mexico for several years.

Reverend Graham Golden, O.Praem.

Reverend Graham Golden, O. Praem., 35, died in an automobile accident on May 21, 2021. Fr. Graham was born to Dan and Deborah Golden on January 8, 1986, in Albuquerque. He was a proud graduate of St. Pius X High School (2004) and a magna cum laude graduate of the University of New Mexico with a BA in Music and Spanish (2008). He entered the Norbertine Community of Santa Maria de la Vid Abbey in 2008. After his two-year novitiate, he attended Catholic Theological Union and the University of Chicago where he received a Master’s Degree from each school.

In 2015 he was ordained a Catholic priest. Fr. Graham entered the Norbertine Community with a desire to serve the poor and marginalized. Already as a seminarian, he served as an intern for the Catholic Campaign for Human Development in the Archdiocese of Santa Fe. The Campaign works to address the plague of poverty. After ordination, Fr. Graham worked with The Catholic Foundation as a Regional Council Coordinator to assess the needs of rural communities, particularly in Northern New Mexico. Subsequently, he served as associate and then pastor of Our Lady of the Most Holy Rosary Catholic Community (2018), and most recently became pastor of St. Augustine Parish at Isleta Pueblo. Fr. Graham was also the archdiocesan coordinator for the annual Pilgrimage for Vocations.

At Santa Maria de la Vid Abbey he had multiple responsibilities: vocation director, formation director for seminarians, founder of the Office of Christian Discipleship and Religious Vocation, as well as initiator of the annual Art at the Abbey Exhibition.

Fr. Graham is survived by his parents, Dan and Deborah Golden, his sister Aiyuan and nephew Qiao Rong, and his Norbertine Brothers and Sisters.
